intro: Arthrocnemum leiostachyum, commonly known as the coastal sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and coastal regions of Africa, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that thrives in sandy and saline soils, often found in dune environments. The plant has small, narrow leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss, and it produces yellow flowers in clusters. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to anchor itself in loose, shifting sands. Arthrocnemum leiostachyum plays a role in stabilizing dunes and preventing soil erosion in its native habitats.
